intro: Drudeophytum howellii, commonly known as Howell's daisy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Drudeophytum howellii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
